posts.post_content: Ganryu, ANYBODY can make a deck to defeat a specific color. We can thank all the color hosers for this (Karma, Gloom, Flashfires, Lifeforce, Deathgrip, etc.). Magical Hack and Sleight of Mind are the 2 ways to protect against them.

Posted By: Sironos (1/14/2011 1:22:18 AM)

posts.post_content:
A friend of mine has built a white deck specifically for the purpose of defeating black decks. Most of the meta-game around where he used to play consisted of black decks. It has [Circle of Protection: Black](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Circle of Protection: Black), [Order of Leitbur](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Order of Leitbur) etc.  
  
One large part of that deck: Karma.  
  
I challenged myself in building a primarily black deck to defeat it. I splashed blue for [Magical Hack](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magical Hack). Let's just say that he found a use for [Disenchant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Disenchant) on his next turn that he probably didn't expect.
posts.html:
A friend of mine has built a white deck specifically for the purpose of defeating black decks. Most of the meta-game around where he used to play consisted of black decks. It has Circle of Protection: Black, Order of Leitbur etc.

One large part of that deck: Karma.

I challenged myself in building a primarily black deck to defeat it. I splashed blue for Magical Hack. Let's just say that he found a use for Disenchant on his next turn that he probably didn't expect.

Posted By: Ganryu (11/26/2009 5:16:21 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I want to play this with [Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth) and either [Opalescence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Opalescence) and [True Conviction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=True Conviction) or [Personal Sanctuary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Personal Sanctuary).  
  
I prefer the former because it's sillier by far.  
  
P.S. @SquareHippy: Make sure your opponent never reduces your life to less than the number of lands you control, or [Karma](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karma) will kill you before [Tamanoa](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tamanoa)'s life-gain resolves.
posts.html:
I want to play this with Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth and either Opalescence and True Conviction or Personal Sanctuary.

I prefer the former because it's sillier by far.

P.S. @SquareHippy: Make sure your opponent never reduces your life to less than the number of lands you control, or Karma will kill you before Tamanoa's life-gain resolves.
